bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Order for Allowing Appeal, Petition for Order Allowing Appeal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF FLETCHER DECKER FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND A WRIT OF CERTI- ORARI : : :
No. 6125 ORDER ALLOWING APPEAL
The court having heard Fletcher Decker, by and through his attorneys, Beeler & Sullivan, and being fully advised in the premises,
IT IS ORDERED that the appeal prayed for in the foregoing petition be allowed as prayed for by said petitioner, by and through his attorneys, Beeler & Sullivan, and

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that said petitioner may be at large pending said appeal, upon depositing Liberty Bonds or cash, in the sum of Six Hundred ($600) Dollars with the clerk of the above en- titled court for his appearance to answer the judgment of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.
DONE IN OPEN COURT this 7th day of October, 1921.
Edward Cushman J U D G E.
C.K. R. Saunders + regional asst. U.S. atty U.S. Dist. Attorney.
Received a copy of the writ Robt. C Saunders Oct. 1921
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF FLETCHER DECKER FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND A WRIT OF CERTI- ORARI.: : :
PETITION FOR ORDER ALLOWING APPEAL.

Petitioner, Fletcher Decker, by and through his attorneys, Beeler & Sullivan, feeling himself aggrieved by the order, judgment, and decision of the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the above entitled court, wherein said court dismissed petitioner's petition for writ of habeas corpus and writ of certiorari, and remanding the petitioner to remain in the custody of the United States Marshal to await the extradition mandate of the Secretary of State, and the said Fletcher Decker, having given notice of appeal from said order, judgment and decision, to the clerk of this honorable court, and to the United States Attorney for this District, prays that his ap- peal to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals of the Ninth Circuit may be allowed, and that a transcript of the record and all proceedings and papers upon which said order, judgment and decisions were made and entered, duly authenticated, may be sent to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.

Your petitioner respectfully prays that on account there- of, this appeal be allowed, and to correct the errors complained of, and to reverse, annul and set aside the said judgment and de- cree made and entered in the premises on the 14th day of September, 1921.

Your petitioner further states that he will within the time allowed by law, file herein his assignment of errors alleged to have been committed in the above entitled proceedings, and that the Liberty Bonds, in the sum of Six Hundred ($600) Dollars, now in the custody of the said clerk of this honorable court be allowed to remain as sufficient bond for the appearance of this peti- tioner, and to act as a bond to answer said judgment of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and to give himself into the custody upon said order of said Court or upon order of this Honorable Court.
DATED AT SEATTLE, WASHINGTON, this 7th day of October, 1921.
Beeler & Sullivan
Received a copy of the within petition this 7th day of October, 1921.
Robert C. Saunders Attorney for United States.
FIlED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT Western District of Washington Northern Division TH OCT 7 1921 By F.M. Harshberger, Clerk By D.E. Leitch Deputy
